name: Recherche de produits et comparaison de prix alimentée par l'IA avec Google Search et OpenAI
description:
**Comment ça fonctionne
**
Ce flux de travail intelligent agit comme votre assistant personnel de shopping, vous aidant à rechercher rapidement des produits et à trouver des options d'achat potentielles basées sur vos descriptions détaillées. Il fait automatiquement :

- Prend votre description de produit en langage naturel (par exemple, "un sac à dos de randonnée durable et léger pour des voyages de plusieurs jours avec une bonne ventilation").

- Utilise l'IA pour générer des requêtes de recherche optimisées afin de trouver des produits pertinents en ligne.

- Exécute ces recherches dans l'index de Google.

- Analyse les meilleurs résultats de recherche (titres et extraits) à l'aide de l'IA pour identifier les types de produits courants, les caractéristiques et les détaillants potentiels.

- Compile un rapport résumé concis avec des informations clés et des liens directs vers les pages de produits pertinentes.

- Livrer le rapport complet dans votre boîte de réception, vous guidant vers les prochaines étapes pour l'achat.

Gagnez du temps sur la recherche de produits et obtenez des recommandations plus intelligentes pour votre prochain achat !

**Étapes de configuration**

La configuration de ce flux de travail est plus avancée que les précédents en raison de l'intégration avec une API de recherche spécialisée, prenant généralement environ 30 à 60 minutes. Vous devrez :

- Configurer un moteur de recherche personnalisé Google (CSE) : Cela implique de créer un CSE dans votre Google Cloud Platform et d'obtenir une clé API et un ID de moteur de recherche. Des instructions détaillées sont fournies dans le flux de travail.

- Obtenir des clés API pour votre service d'IA préféré (par exemple, OpenAI, Google AI).

- Connecter votre service de messagerie préféré (par exemple, Gmail) pour recevoir le rapport.

- Fournir une description claire et détaillée du produit que vous recherchez.

Toutes les instructions de configuration détaillées et les conseils de configuration spécifiques, y compris la configuration du CSE, sont fournies dans le flux de travail lui-même à l'aide de notes autocollantes.

notes.text:
### 1. Start Workflow

This `Manual Trigger` node is used for easy testing of your product research.

**To trigger the workflow manually:** Click the 'Execute Workflow' button in the top right.

**For automation:** You could connect this to a `Webhook` (if you build a simple form for product descriptions) or a `Google Sheets` node (to read new product requests from a spreadsheet).

### 2. Define Product Description

This `Set` node defines the product you're looking for using natural language.

**How to use:**
* **For testing:** Directly edit the 'Value' field with a detailed description of the product you want to find.
* **For automation:** This could come from a previous node (e.g., a form submission via a `Webhook` or a cell in a `Google Sheet`) using an expression like `{{ $json.yourInputFieldName }}`.

values.name: productDescription
values.value: Lightweight, durable hiking backpack for multi-day trips (30-40L), good ventilation, comfortable for long hikes.

notes.text:
### 3. AI: Generate Search Queries

This `OpenAI` node takes your natural language `productDescription` and uses AI to generate effective search queries.

**Setup:**
1.  **OpenAI Credential:** Click on 'Credentials' and select 'New Credential'. Provide your OpenAI API Key (starts with `sk-`). Save it.
2.  **Model:** You can change `gpt-3.5-turbo` to `gpt-4o` for potentially better query generation (but higher cost).
3.  **Prompt:** The system prompt guides the AI to generate concise search queries suitable for a search engine.

**Output:** The AI will output a string with queries separated by newlines.

messages.content: You are a search query optimizer. Given a product description, generate 3-5 concise and effective Google search queries to find that product. Output each query on a new line. Do not add any conversational text or numbering.

notes.text:
### 4. Split Queries

This `Function` node takes the multi-line string of search queries generated by the AI and splits them into separate items. Each item will then be processed individually by the next node.

**Output:** If the AI generated 3 queries, this node will output 3 separate items, each with a `query` field (e.g., `{{ $json.query }}`).

**No configuration needed here**, it automatically processes the AI output.

### 5. Google Custom Search (CSE) - The Core!

This `Google Custom Search` node performs the actual web search using your configured Google Custom Search Engine.

**Setup (CRITICAL!):**
1.  **Google API Credential:** Click 'Credentials' and select 'New Credential'. Choose 'Google API'. You'll need the **API Key** you generated in the Google Cloud Console (Step 1 in the overall setup).
2.  **Search Engine ID:** This is the ID you obtained from `cse.google.com` (Step 1 in the overall setup).
3.  **Query:** This field is pre-filled with `={{ $json.query }}`, pulling each query generated by the AI and splitting it.
4.  **Num:** (Optional) Limits the number of results per query. Default is 10; set to 5 for a more concise output.

**Output:** This node will output search results, including `title`, `link`, and `snippet` for each result.

### 6. Combine Search Results

This `Set` node gathers all the search results from the multiple CSE queries into a single, combined item.

**How it works:** `{{ $('Google Custom Search (CSE)').all() }}` is an advanced expression that collects *all* items from *all* executions of the 'Google Custom Search (CSE)' node into one array. This is essential for feeding all results to the AI for summarization.

### 7. AI: Summarize Products & Prices

This `OpenAI` node analyzes all the combined search results and synthesizes them into a readable report.

**Purpose:** The AI will try to identify product types, common features, and potential places to buy, based on the `title`, `snippet`, and `link` data from the search results.

**Input:** The 'User' prompt feeds all the search result data to the AI.

**Output:** The AI-generated summary report.

messages.content: You are a product research assistant. Analyze the provided search results (titles, snippets, links) for a product. Identify common themes, product types, key features, and suggest where the user might find the best prices (e.g., mention specific retailers or general price comparison sites if they appear in results). Structure your output as a concise report with bullet points for key findings and a list of top 3-5 relevant links.

notes.text:
### 8. Send Report Email

This `Gmail` node sends the final AI-generated product research report to your inbox.

**Setup:**
1.  **Gmail Credential:** Select your existing Gmail API credential.
2.  **From Email:** Enter your Gmail address (this must be the same account you authenticated).
3.  **To Email:** **IMPORTANT: Change `YOUR_RECIPIENT_EMAIL@example.com` to your actual email address!**
4.  **Subject:** Includes the product description for easy reference.
5.  **Text:** The email body contains the summary generated by the AI.

**After setting up, click 'Execute Workflow' (from the 'Manual Trigger' node) to receive your product research report!**

parameters.text:
Hello!

Here's your AI-powered product research report from n8n for:
"{{ $node["Set Product Description"].json.productDescription }}"

---

{{ $node["AI: Summarize Products & Prices"].json.choices[0].message.content }}

---

*This report was generated automatically by n8n. Please use the provided links to explore products and prices further.*
parameters.subject: AI Shopping Assistant: Product Research Report for "{{ $node["Set Product Description"].json.productDescription }}"

user.name: Piotr Sobolewski
user.bio: AI PhD with 7 years experience as a game dev CEO, currently teaching, helping others and building something new.

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)
